ref: 13021 saṁvārayati ʻ keeps off ʼ MBh., caus. of saṁvr̥ṇōti ʻ covers up ʼ MBh., ʻ puts in order ʼ Kathās. [√vr̥1]
K. sawārun ʻ to undertake, arrange, put in order ʼ;
S. sãvāraṇu ʻ to arrange, put in order, beautify ʼ (whence intr. sãviraṇu ʻ to be arranged, &c. ʼ);
L. sãvāraṇ ʻ to make ready, adorn, clean ʼ (whence intr. sãvaraṇ ʻ to be made ready, &c. ʼ);
Or. saã̄ribā, suār˚, suã̄ḷibā ʻ to card coarse cotton with the fingers, separate hair of head into strands, massage the body ʼ; O
Aw. saṁvāraï, savāṁraï ʻ builds, prepares, decorates ʼ;
H. sãwārṇā, samārnā ʻ to arrange, prepare, deck ʼ (whence intr. sãwarnā ʻ to be arranged, &c. ʼ); O
Marw. savāraï ʻ prepares (vegetables and other food) for cooking ʼ; O
G. samāraï ʻ keeps in order, brushes ʼ,
G. samārvũ ʻ to repair, erect after damage, adorn, weed, prepare (vegetables) for cooking ʼ. -- Phonet. (but less prob.)
K., poss. < samācarati (*samācalati) or *samāracati or samā́rabhatē, with one or more of which saṁvārayati may have collided. Forms of
